events.name: Women in Tech - Coding & Impact: Connecting the dots from why to how
events.description:
Gillian Tee is a native Singaporean and the co-founder of Rocketrip, a Y-Combinator, Crunchfund and Bessemer Ventures-backed startup that's raised more than USD 17M.
She's also the founder of online code school CodeUpStart with a community of more than 10,000 developers. Most recently she's in the process of launching a second company backed by 500 Startups.
An avid coder (read, geek), designer and whiskey lover, Gillian studied Computer Science in university and got an MBA from Columbia Business School. Being able to empower others in their tech and entrepreneurial paths gets her up every morning and keeps her going through all the ups and downs in the tech world!
More about Gillian here: ttp://www.femalefounderstories.com/gillian-tee.html
events.location: Hive 40 pax, 59 New Bridge Road, , Singapore

events.name: Let's meet to share about improvised lab equipment and home experiments
events.description: This commences a series of regular meet-ups, tentatively scheduled for the first Friday evening of the month. In this week's meeting, we will be sharing our experience in building a DIY automated lab robot, and have an open sharing of projects and ideas on food science and DIY Bio. More info at: www.OpenBio.asia
events.location: Starbucks at University Town, NUS, 8 College Ave East, Singapore

events.name: Maker Appreciation Dinner (MAD) 2016
events.description:
Let’s get MAD for the Maker Appreciation Dinner (MAD) 2016, a one of a kind party for makers by makers. MAD 2016 is about coming together as one big maker community, recognising our past efforts in Maker Faire 2016, and looking forward as we celebrate our 51st National Day! We have a whole night of fun planned out for you and our non-exhaustive list of secret highlights include: 

- Heat gun S’mores, an upgrade of the campfire favorite.
- Munchies, yummies, and drinkies to keep our hungry makers well-fed.
- Devious Maker Challenges that will stretch your maker muscles and test your crafty cerebrum.
- An opportunity to meet makers and make friends. MAD is THE event for the community to come together as we welcome new friends and strengthen old friendships. This event is open to the public so all are welcome!
- Our culminating rocket launch to seal the deal and set the tone for National Day festivities.

Tickets prices are going at $4 for food and drinks. Maker Faire 2016 participants will have the option to attend for free as a big thank you for your efforts (a secret discount code has been sent to you). Sign up now and grab a friend or two along!

http://bit.ly/omgmad16
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969

events.name: Future Fridays: What We've Forgotten
events.description:
For our final session on the theme of identity, we will welcome the co-author of Singapore: A Biography,  Yu-Mei Balasingamchow to share about the gaps in the stories we tell about ourselves. With this as a starting point, we will build a Museum of Forgetting -- what will you put into it?

==

In the run up to this session, you may want to visit one of our local museums to observe which stories are told (or not), and how. 

As places for this session is limited, please write in to chewlin.kay@sl2square.org to register.
events.location: Sustainable Living Lab (SL2), 111 Middle Rd, Unit 01-02, Singapore 188969
